author: @CTVWindsor
title: Golf pro Bob Panasik dies at 82 | CTV News
text: [Skip to main content](#main) Golf pro Bob Panasik dies at 82 Legendary Canadian golfer and Windsor native Bob Panasik has died. The two-time Canadian PGA champ was no stranger to local links, and set a record as the youngest player to play all for rounds in a PGA Tour event at 15 years old in 1957. It was a record that stood until 2013. Panasik was inducted into the Canadian Golf Hall of Fame in 2005. He was 82 years old. author: Alexandra Hartman
title: NYC Deli Rewards Kids' Good Grades
text:
New York City Deli owner Rewards Kids’ Good Grades, Sparks Viral Sensation A Staten Island deli owner is making headlines for his innovative approach to encouraging academic success. The owner of Zack’s Finest Deli, a Yemeni father of three, has implemented a program that rewards children for their good grades, creating a buzz within the community and beyond.
Zack’s Finest Deli: Where Good Grades Get Rewarded The program at Zack’s Finest Deli offers a tangible incentive for students to excel in their studies. By showing their report cards, kids can earn special treats and discounts, fostering a positive association with academic achievement.
This initiative has not only boosted morale among local students but has also turned Zack’s Finest Deli into a community hub. The deli has become a place where academic accomplishments are celebrated and rewarded.
The Viral Impact of a Community-Focused Business News of the deli’s unique reward program has spread rapidly, garnering attention on social media platforms. People are praising the owner’s commitment to supporting local youth and promoting education. The heartwarming story exemplifies how small businesses can make a big difference in their communities.
The positive attention has also translated into increased business for Zack’s Finest Deli,as more people seek to support the establishment that invests in the future generation.
Why Rewarding academic Achievement Matters Rewarding academic achievement can have a profound impact on a child’s motivation and self-esteem. Positive reinforcement encourages students to continue striving for excellence and instills a sense of pride in their accomplishments.
Moreover, programs like the one at Zack’s Finest Deli can definitely help bridge the gap between school and the community, creating a supportive ecosystem that values education.
how Other Businesses Can Support Education Zack’s Finest Deli sets a powerful example for other businesses looking to give back to their communities. Consider these ideas:
Offer discounts or special promotions for students with good grades. Partner with local schools to provide scholarships or educational resources. Host tutoring sessions or workshops at your business location. Reward Type benefits Implementation Discounts Attracts customers, incentivizes achievement offer a percentage off for students showing a report card with good grades. Free Items Creates excitement,builds goodwill Provide a free small item (e.g., cookie, drink) for achieving honor roll. Scholarships Supports higher education, long-term impact Partner with local schools to fund scholarships for deserving students. Did You Know? Studies show that students who receive positive reinforcement for their academic efforts are more likely to maintain good grades and pursue higher education.
This initiative by the Staten Island deli owner highlights the significant role that local businesses can play in fostering a culture of learning and achievement. It serves as an inspiration for other entrepreneurs to invest in the future of their communities.
What kind of rewards program would be most effective in your community? How can local businesses better support education?
The Enduring Value of Community Support In an era where corporate social responsibility is gaining prominence, Zack’s Finest Deli’s initiative highlights the power of small-scale, community-driven efforts. By directly incentivizing academic success, the deli is not just boosting grades but also fostering a sense of community pride and mutual support. This approach resonates deeply with people, creating a positive feedback loop where success is celebrated and encouraged.
The impact of such programs extends beyond immediate academic improvements. It cultivates a mindset where education is valued and achievement is recognized. This,in turn,can have long-term effects on the students’ aspirations and their contributions to society.
Frequently Asked Questions about Rewarding Good Grades
Why Is It important to Reward Kids’ good Grades? Rewarding good grades provides positive reinforcement, motivating students to continue striving for academic excellence and instilling a sense of pride in their accomplishments. How Does Zack’s Finest Deli Reward good Grades? Zack’s finest Deli offers special treats and discounts to students who show their report cards with good grades, creating a tangible incentive for academic achievement. What Are Some Alternative Ways To Reward Academic Achievement? Besides discounts and treats, alternative rewards could include scholarships, educational resources, tutoring sessions, or public recognition for outstanding performance. Can Rewarding Grades Improve Community Values? Yes, by creating a supportive ecosystem that values education, programs that reward good grades can definitely help bridge the gap between school and community, fostering a culture of learning and achievement. Are There Any Potential Drawbacks To Rewarding Academic Grades? Some argue that solely focusing on grades might undermine intrinsic motivation or create undue pressure. it’s essential to balance external rewards with fostering a genuine love for learning. Where Is Zack’s Finest Deli Located? Zack’s Finest Deli is located in Staten Island, New York City. The deli owner has gone viral for rewarding good grades. Share this inspiring story and let us know your thoughts.What other creative ways can businesses support education?
What specific criteria are typically required by NYC delis to qualify for their grade-based rewards programs?
NYC Deli Rewards Kids’ Good grades: A Recipe for Success New York City delis are going above and beyond, recognizing the outstanding efforts of students and fueling their academic achievements! Many local eateries are implementing fun and effective programs that not only support the community but also foster a love for learning. This article explores the trend of NYC delis rewarding kids’ good grades. Find out how this collaboration translates into delicious incentives like student discounts, free treats, and special deals, and boosts scholastic motivation. We’ll delve into finding the best grade-based discounts, highlighting the delicious rewards, and discussing the positive impact on students and families alike.
the rise of “Grade Rewards”: A Winning Strategy The concept behind NYC delis rewarding kids’ good grades is simple yet brilliant: incentivize academic excellence. This approach offers tangible benefits to students who work diligently in school, making the achievement of good grades feel even more rewarding. The promise of a delicious reward, like a free slice of pizza or a discount on a sandwich, serves as a powerful motivator.
This trend is more than just a marketing gimmick; it’s a way for local businesses to engage with the community and contribute to the educational success of its youth. It showcases how a combination of incentives and strategic marketing can boost local business via word-of-mouth marketing and community engagement.
Benefits of Deli Grade Rewards Increased Student Motivation: Kids are motivated to improve their grades. Community Engagement: Businesses build stronger relationships with local families. Positive Reinforcement: Celebrates academic achievements. Boosted Business: Encourages walk-in traffic and customer loyalty. Healthy competition: Children can encourage each other in educational pursuits. Delicious Discounts: What’s on the Menu for Good Grades? The specific rewards offered by NYC delis vary, but the common theme is a delicious treat for a good report card! From classic delis to pizzerias and sandwich shops, students can expect a wide range of incentives.
Delis usually offer a tiered system for these rewards: the better the grades, the bigger the incentives! Here’s what you can typically find:
A’s: Free appetizers or a generously sized discount. B’s: A free side or a smaller discount on a meal. C’s: A single free item, such as a drink or a cookie. These are common rewards, but there are delis that offer special promotions for honors awards, or even an entire free meal for student athletes who excel along their educational pursuits.
Key Search Terms: student discount, free pizza, good grade rewards, best deli deals NYC, kids incentives, academic rewards, NYC report card deals.
Deli Reward Criteria Location (Example) Mama’s Deli free Slice of Pizza Showing Report Card with at least one “A” Manhattan, NY Sal’s Pizzeria 10% discount on the entire purchase Report card with B’s and above Brooklyn, NY joe’s Sandwich Shop Free Drink and Side Dish showing Report Card with all A’s and B’s Queens, NY Finding the Best Deals: Tips and strategies Finding the best deli rewards in NYC requires a little homework. Here’s how to be successful:
Check Local Deli Websites & Social Media: Many delis announce their rewards programs online. Ask around the Neighborhood: Encourage your kids to find out what incentives their classmates are already taking advantage of. Look For Signage: Many delis showcase their promotions with in-store signs. Call Ahead: If you’re not sure, a quick phone call can save you a trip. Exploring Specific NYC neighborhood Deals New York city boasts many diverse neighborhoods, ranging from diverse restaurant selections to cultural distinctions. here’s an example of where you discover more information:
Lower East Side: Explore the historic district and its hidden food gems West Village: Discover the artistic neighborhood and the delis and cafes that support local education Upper East Side: A neighborhood known for its family-friendly surroundings. LSI Keywords: NYC student discounts, report card incentives, deli offers NYC, report card freebies, NY deli deals, school incentives near me.
the Impact: More Than Just a Meal The positive impact of these programs extends far beyond giving kids a tasty meal. It helps create a supportive environment that encourages academic achievement. The message is clear: hard work pays off, and the community supports students’ educational journey.
This win-win scenario fosters closer relationships between businesses and the local community. Not only do these incentives encourage student motivation, but also create valuable experiences.
Additional Search Terms: Children’s programs New York, learning rewards, school support incentives, community involvement programs, student incentive program.
By implementing these programs, delis are successfully nurturing academic achievement while fostering stronger community bonds, creating a truly rewarding experience for everyone involved.

author: @infobae
title: Andalucía reduce a ocho las carreteras cerradas o con cortes de tráfico por los efectos de la DANA, 5 en Cádiz - Infobae
text:
La Dirección General de Tráfico (DGT) mantiene con cortes o cerradas al tráfico a las 14,00 horas de este viernes, 1 de noviembre, un total de ocho carreteras en Andalucía por inundación de la calzada a causa de la DANA que viene afectando a la comunidad durante los últimos días, cinco de ellas en la provincia de Cádiz, dos en Granada y una en Sevilla. Son nueve carreteras menos de las 17 que se encontraban en esta situación en la red andaluza a las 9,00 horas de la mañana.
De esta manera, según detalla la web de la DGT, consultada por Europa Press, en Cádiz permanecen cerradas al tráfico la CA-3113 en la carretera al Portal, la CA-5101 entre La Garrapata y Gibalbín, la CA-5200 en Alcalá de los Gazules, la CA-6101 en Coto de Bornos, y la CA-9101 entre Olvera y La Muela.
En la provincia de Granada son dos las carreteras cerradas al tráfico; en concreto, la A-4200, entre Río de Baza y Benamaurel, del kilómetro 3 a 11, y la GR-4104 entre El Bejarín y Benalúa del kilómetro 15 a 16.
Finalmente, en la provincia de Sevilla presenta cortes parciales y circulación difícil la carretera SE-4104 en Alcolea del Río, en el kilómetro 4.

author: CNN Chile
title: Declaran culpables a dos falsos médicos por muerte de mujer en clínica clandestina en Las Condes
text: [Comparte en Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.cnnchile.com/pais/culpables-dos-falsos-medicos-muerte-mujer-clinica-clandestina-las-condes_20231228/) [Comparte en Twitter](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://www.cnnchile.com/pais/culpables-dos-falsos-medicos-muerte-mujer-clinica-clandestina-las-condes_20231228/) Este jueves, el 3.º Tribunal Oral en lo Penal de Santiago llevó a cabo la lectura del veredicto para los tres imputados por el homicidio de Leslie Vergara. Se trata de Teresa Díaz (75), Jorge Flores (51) y Mónica Flores (54), una madre y sus hijos principales, sospechosos de la muerte de la mujer de 32 años que perdió la vida después de someterse a una intervención quirúrgica en una clínica clandestina en la comuna de Las Condes que operada por los imputados. En el veredicto, se determinó que Teresa Díaz y Mónica Flores fueron responsables del delito de homicidio simple, mientras que Jorge Flores fue absuelto de esta acusación. No obstante, los tres fueron considerados autores del delito de ejercer de manera ilegal la profesión de médico cirujano. El trágico suceso tuvo lugar en febrero de 2022, cuando Leslie Vergara se sometió a una cirugía para aumentar sus glúteos en la clínica clandestina. Durante la intervención, la silicona inyectada ingresó a una vena, provocando el fallecimiento de la paciente. Los imputados, quienes supuestamente obtuvieron títulos de Medicina General de la Universidad de Tarapacá en 2015, habrían operado a 48 mujeres desde entonces, generando problemas de salud, especialmente filtraciones en los implantes, en la mayoría de los casos. La sentencia detalla un historial de prácticas médicas ilegales que han afectado a numerosas personas.
